intro: Eriogonum platyphyllum, commonly known as the broadleaf buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its broad, flat leaves and clusters of small, white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, winged seeds that are dispersed by wind, aiding in its spread across open landscapes. Eriogonum platyphyllum plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing nectar for pollinators in its native range.
